page.title: 02COMMUNICATIONS:WENHAM,RAYDON
page.content: IN Great Wenham the Post office which had been run for 20 years by Mrs.Madder closed on her retirement in January 1984.There are two letter boxes, one in the wall of the old rectory opposite the church and one near the council houses, which are collected twice a day at 9.15a.m. and 4p.m. except Sundays. The postal deliveries are via Stratford St. Mary which gets the post from Colchester in Essex and therefore usually results in a delay of one day. In Raydon the only shop in the village serves primarily as a Post office and has a telephone call box and a letter box adjacent to the building.The postal delivery is via Hadleigh.
